title: David Organizes Levites
shortSummary: In 1 Chronicles 23, King David, in his old age, organizes the Levites for temple service under Solomon’s reign. He enumerates their numbers, divides them into families and duties, and establishes their roles in worship and temple maintenance, highlighting the importance of orderly service to God’s house.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Late reign of King David, prior to Solomon’s official kingship

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The aging king of Israel who organizes the Levites for temple service and prepares for Solomon’s reign.

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: David’s son, appointed king over Israel, who will oversee the temple worship and service.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: Brother of Moses and chief of the priestly line, set apart for sanctifying the most holy things and offering incense.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The man of God whose sons are counted among the Levites but not priests.

definitions.definition: Members of the tribe of Levi set apart for religious duties related to the tabernacle and later the temple.
Gatekeepers responsible for guarding the entrances of the temple and its courts.
Divisions or groups organized for temple service, often rotating duties.
To set apart as holy, dedicated to God’s service.

outline.heading: David Appoints Solomon and Gathers Leaders
outline.description: David, now old, makes Solomon king and gathers Israel’s princes, priests, and Levites, signaling a transition of leadership and preparation for temple worship.

outline.heading: Numbering and Division of the Levites
outline.description: The Levites aged 30 and above are counted, totaling 38,000, and divided into groups assigned to specific temple duties, emphasizing organized worship.

outline.heading: Genealogies of Levi’s Families
outline.description: Detailed listing of the descendants of Levi’s sons Gershon, Kohath, and Merari, establishing the hereditary lines responsible for various temple services.

outline.heading: Levites’ Service from Age Twenty and Their Duties
outline.description: David lowers the age for Levite service to twenty, reflecting a time of peace, and outlines their responsibilities in assisting priests, maintaining the sanctuary, and performing worship duties.

application: Organize your spiritual life with intentional roles and responsibilities to serve God effectively.
Recognize the importance of preparation and orderly worship in honoring God’s presence.
Value the heritage and continuity of God’s work through faithful service across generations.
Commit to serving God wholeheartedly, understanding that every role in His work is vital.

keyVerses.text: So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
keyVerses.significance: Marks the transition of leadership and the fulfillment of God’s promise regarding Solomon’s kingship.

keyVerses.text: Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
keyVerses.significance: Demonstrates the careful organization and significant manpower dedicated to temple service.

keyVerses.text: The sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister unto him, and to bless in his name for ever.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the special priestly role of Aaron’s descendants in mediating before God.

keyVerses.text: And to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise at even;
keyVerses.significance: Emphasizes the continual worship and gratitude due to God as a central part of temple service.
